inputs.name: listingAddress
inputs.description: Address of the listing of which the status is being updated

abiDocs.name: updateStatus
abiDocs.notice: Updates a listing's status from 'application' to 'listing' or resolves a challenge or appeal  or appeal challenge if one exists.

inputs.name: listingAddress
inputs.description: The listingAddress associated with the appeal

inputs.name: data
inputs.description: Extra data relevant to the appeal challenge. Think URLs.

abiDocs.name: challengeGrantedAppeal
abiDocs.details: challengeID is a nonce created by the PLCRVoting contract, regular challenges and appeal challenges share the same nonce variable
abiDocs.return: challengeID associated with the appeal challenge
abiDocs.notice: Starts a poll for a listingAddress which has recently been granted a challenge. If the poll passes, the granted appeal will be overturned. In order to start a challenge, the following conditions must be met: - There is an active appeal on the listing - This appeal was granted - This appeal has not yet been challenged - The expiry time of the appeal challenge is greater than the current time - The challenger transfers tokens to the TCR equal to appeal fee paid by appeal requester

inputs.name: listingAddress
inputs.description: A listingAddress with an unresolved challenge

abiDocs.name: challengeCanBeResolved
abiDocs.details: Determines whether voting has concluded in a challenge for a given listingAddress. Throws if no challenge exists.

inputs.name: length
inputs.description: The new value for the "Judge Appeal Phase" length

abiDocs.name: setAppealLength
abiDocs.notice: Set new value for the length of "Judge Appeal Phase" Can only be called by Appellate, since only they can decide how long they need to process appeals

inputs.name: listingAddress
inputs.description: address of listing that has challenged result that the user wants to appeal

abiDocs.name: requestAppeal
abiDocs.notice: Requests an appeal for a listing that has been successfully challenged (and had state updated) In order to request appeal, the following conditions must be met: - voting for challenge has ended - (now < request appeal expiry)  - appeal not already requested - appeal requester transfers appealFee to TCR

inputs.name: amount
inputs.description: The number of ERC20 tokens to increase a user's unstaked deposit

abiDocs.name: deposit
abiDocs.details: Allows the owner of a listingHash to increase their unstaked deposit.

inputs.name: listingAddress
inputs.description: Address of contract to apply

inputs.name: amount
inputs.description: The number of ERC20 tokens a user is willing to potentially stake

abiDocs.name: apply
abiDocs.details: Allows a user to start an application. Takes tokens from user and sets apply stage end time.

inputs.name: listingAddress
inputs.description: The listingAddress whose status is to be examined

abiDocs.name: appWasMade
abiDocs.details: Returns true if apply was called for this listingAddress

inputs.name: listingAddress
inputs.description: The listingAddress whose status is to be examined

abiDocs.name: challengeExists
abiDocs.details: Returns true if the application/listing has an unresolved challenge

inputs.name: challengeID
inputs.description: The PLCR pollID of the challenge a reward is being claimed for

inputs.name: salt
inputs.description: The salt of a voter's commit hash in the given poll

abiDocs.name: claimAppealChallengeReward
abiDocs.notice: Called by a voter to claim their reward for each completed vote. Someone must call updateStatus() before this can be called.

inputs.name: challengeID
inputs.description: The ID of an appeal challenge to determine a reward for

abiDocs.name: determineAppealChallengeReward
abiDocs.notice: Determines the number of tokens awarded to the winning party in a challenge.

inputs.name: fee
inputs.description: The new value for the appeal fee

abiDocs.name: setAppealFee
abiDocs.notice: Set new value for appeal fee Can only be called by Appellate, since only they can decide what fee they require

inputs.name: listingAddress
inputs.description: The address of the listing associated with the appeal

abiDocs.name: grantAppeal
abiDocs.notice: Grants a requested appeal, if the appeal has not expired (or already been granted) Can only be called by appellate (JEC)

abiDocs.name: exitListing
abiDocs.notice: Allows the owner of a listing to remove the listingHash from the whitelist Returns all tokens to the owner of the listing

inputs.name: challengeID
inputs.description: The PLCR pollID of the challenge a reward is being claimed for

inputs.name: salt
inputs.description: The salt of a voter's commit hash in the given poll

abiDocs.name: claimReward
abiDocs.notice: Called by a voter to claim their reward for each completed vote. Someone must call updateStatus() before this can be called.

inputs.name: voter
inputs.description: The address of the voter whose reward balance is to be returned

inputs.name: challengeID
inputs.description: The pollID of the challenge a reward balance is being queried for

inputs.name: salt
inputs.description: The salt of the voter's commit hash in the given poll

abiDocs.name: voterReward
abiDocs.details: Calculates the provided voter's token reward for the given poll.
abiDocs.return: The uint indicating the voter's reward

inputs.name: challengeID
inputs.description: The ID of the appeal challenge to query

inputs.name: voter
inputs.description: The voter whose claim status to query for the provided challengeID

abiDocs.name: hasClaimedChallengeAppealTokens
abiDocs.notice: Getter for Challenge hasClaimedTokens mappings inside an appeal challenge

inputs.name: length
inputs.description: The new value for the "Request Appeal Phase" length

abiDocs.name: setMakeAppealLength
abiDocs.notice: Set new value for the length of "Request Appeal Phase" Can only be called by Appellate, allowing this to be controlled  by community adds complexity and seems unnecessary

inputs.name: listingAddress
inputs.description: The listingAddress being challenged, whether listed or in application

inputs.name: data
inputs.description: Extra data relevant to the challenge. Think IPFS hashes.

abiDocs.name: challenge
abiDocs.details: Differs from base implementation in that it stores a timestamp in a mapping corresponding to the end of the request appeal phase, at which point a challenge can be resolved, if no appeal was requested
abiDocs.notice: Starts a poll for a listingAddress which is either in the apply stage or already in the whitelist.  Tokens are taken from the challenger and the applicant's deposits are locked.  Delists listing and returns NO_CHALLENGE if listing's unstakedDeposit is less than current minDeposit

inputs.name: challengeID
inputs.description: The challengeID to query

inputs.name: voter
inputs.description: The voter whose claim status to query for the provided challengeID

inputs.name: challengeID
inputs.description: The ID of a challenge to determine a reward for

abiDocs.name: determineReward
abiDocs.notice: Determines the number of tokens awarded to the winning party in a challenge.

inputs.name: listingAddress
inputs.description: The listingAddress whose status is to be examined

abiDocs.name: canBeWhitelisted
abiDocs.details: Determines whether the given listingAddress be isWhitelist.

inputs.name: amount
inputs.description: The number of ERC20 tokens to withdraw from the unstaked deposit.

abiDocs.name: withdraw
abiDocs.details: Allows the owner of a listingHash to decrease their unstaked deposit.
